page.title: 11Local History (continued)
page.content: A good fireplace was built in the fifteenth/early sixteenth century with three arched niches above the lintel and a wall painting, a 4 foot medallion with the representation of "Angus Dei" with a lamb, halo, crucifix and pennanttoo The painting, olly in the hall, now is in the upper storey. It suggests the house may, at one time, have been a priest's house, possibly connected with Chipley Abbey in the adjoing parish of Poslingford. A list of all interesting listed properties is held at the offices of the Borough of St Edmundsbury in Bury St Edmunds.
